intitule: CAT Data Engineer and Claims Analyst - (M/F)
description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. Context AXA Group Risk Management Property & Casualty (GRM P&C) deals with the most sophisticated P&C technical and actuarial challenges of a leading international insurance company, among which the management of natural catastrophe risks (CAT). Natural variability of climate and seismic activity have demonstrated their devastating potential, climate change bringing additional uncertainty for the future. AXA‚Äôs rapid expansion over the last years ‚Äì both in terms of geographical footprint and P&C insurance offer ‚Äì widely exposes AXA to natural perils, being in charge of the financial protection of its clients. In this context, AXA must maintain state-of-the-art CAT risk management techniques through permanent innovations. AXA GRM brings together high level and multidisciplinary staff with engineers, PhDs, actuaries, data scientists and financials split between Paris, Hong Kong, Z√ºrich and Madrid. Its main missions are focused on the following key areas: develop and maintain models and tools in an efficient and strong IT ecosystem to industrialise deliverables; analyse, model and aggregate the Group‚Äôs risks (economic capital);define and implement the process enabling to secure the undertaken risks (risk appetite, assets accumulation, longevity, natural catastrophe ...); optimize the Group protections (reinsurance, securitization, hedging, etc.) to meet the desired strategy. Job Summary Position belongs to the Group P&C Risk Management Natural Catastrophe and Reinsurance team (21 FTE) which is organized several excellence centers: CAT R&D Modeling, Data Analytics, Accumulation Management and Reinsurance. As part of AXA‚Äôs Internal Model under the Solvency II framework, the CAT and Reinsurance team are primarily in charge of delivering the annual CAT modeling process, consisting of: Collecting CAT exposure data (geographical, physical and financial information) on a per-entity (AXA France, AXA Mexico, AXA Philippines‚Ä¶) and per-location basis (houses, factories, vehicles etc.); Assessing the risk on a per-entity per-peril basis  (cyclones, earthquakes, floods, hailstorms...) which feeds the whole downstream chain locally (pricing, budgets, reinsurance decisions, capital modeling) Estimating the efficiency of the Group Reinsurance covers  Developing in-house models, methodologies and applications to support the CAT risk monitoring. The CAT modelling process has strong strategic and operational impacts since it feeds AXA Economic Capital internal model, the Economic Combined Ratio and NAT CAT budget calculations which drives the earnings and the solvency position of AXA Group. It and determines adequate levels of reinsurance needs, which may boost or hinder profitability. It is also a technical challenge with the data collection of 25+ millions of complex and worldwide policies covering 50+ millions risks, the parallel use of multiple modeling solutions including both physics and machine learning techniques, and finally the assessment of 190 country x peril levels of risk.  Going beyond the use of external solutions, AXA Group develops its own suite of CAT models. The models are nested in a global and robust workflow, largely automated and auditable. In addition, leveraging this Group knowledge and expertise for the business, the team has been developing actuarial frameworks and operational solutions to diffuse CAT model result data, alert and assess live event impacts across the world. The CAT Data Engineer & Claims Analyst will focus on the key challenge of building‚Äôs vulnerability which is one of the three basic modules of catastrophe models (exposure, hazard, vulnerability),  to reinforce the R&D modeling ambitions for the development of various in-house CAT models.  The primary mission will be to build sound data foundations and to grow technical capabilities to meet this challenge. The CAT Data Engineer & Claims Analyst widely interacts with AXA entities, the Group R&D Modeling, Data Analytics and Aggregation teams and benefits from the IT expertise of FTEs (internal consulting). It will imply weekly collaboration with  AXA entities,  IT developers and continuous interactions with scientists and analysts.  The selected candidate will be fully onboarded in the team where he will benefit from the close collaboration with junior and senior experts and will be the group referent of designated P&C operational entities on natural perils‚Äô aspects (notably the annual CAT modeling process).  This position offers a great exposure across the Group, supporting different functions among entities, on a highly valued segment while working on innovative solutions and dealing directly with insurance challenges, on the domain of Climate Change and Natural Hazards. Position Responsibilities Develop and implement vulnerability models for natural hazard damages Create CAT claim collection process from AXA entities following natural hazard events; Design and implement a solid data scheme to gather, standardize and build a homogeneous claim database at Group level, ensuring compliance with security constraints and data privacy (GDPR) Design and implement internal procedures to verify and ensure appropriate data quality assessment for natural hazard damage modeling; Develop buildings‚Äô vulnerability modules and implement civil engineering methods to model property damages exposed to natural hazards Gather historical events‚Äô referencing and loss modeling; Analyse and study resilience strategies for buildings‚Äô vulnerability adaptation to natural hazards and extreme events in the context of climate change Participate in the Group‚Äôs response to climate risks and their evolutions, within its corporate responsibility framework;   Assess CAT risks borne by AXA entities exposed to natural events Provide a technical support to local entities around the collection of their exposure data; Assess CAT risks (cyclones, earthquakes, floods, hailstorms, droughts, wildfires) associated to these exposures using dedicated catastrophe modelling tools; Deliver an AXA view of the gross risk for AXA entities, enabling them to purchase adequate reinsurance in line with their risk appetite; Participate in the Group Reinsurance mechanism and estimate the impact at local and group level buildings‚Äô vulnerability modeling for Natural Hazard damages.
description_entreprise: Avec 6 000 recrutements par an en France rejoignez AXA, un leader mondial de l‚Äôassurance et de la gestion d‚Äôactifs. intitule: Senior QA Analyst - Sales Marketing & Data (x/f/m)
description: What we do Join a team of passionate and hard working entrepreneurs to transform healthcare!  Working in the tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams in an agile environment, while collaborating with product, engineering, design, and business teams. What you‚Äôll do We are looking for a Senior QA Analyst  to join the  Growth  team in our  Business Performance domain .  As a  Senior QA Analyst  your mission will be to work on Doctolib's growth. You will be working in a feature team developing great user experience, referral programs, try -out sessions and clear value propositions. Becoming a subject matter expert in the scope of your feature team Be the user champion and ensure the best experience for our users by challenging product specifications  Improving our approach regarding accessibility to ensure inclusivity for all users will be a key aspect of your role Defining test strategy during project planning and development in relation with product managers and engineers Ensuring the test suite remains effective and efficient through time  Ensuring that the feature team has a common understanding of how to guarantee highest standards of quality Collect and report on testing metrics and defects, and collaborate with developers and PMs to prioritize their resolution Take the lead on initiatives to reduce bug injection and facilitate defect investigations (exploratory testing, dialogue with tech support teams,...) Who you are If you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply! You possess experience in a QA role with a system at scale in a distributed app environment. You are proactive, involved, curious, and collaborative. You also have a strong sense of ownership on what you build and you have a bias for action. Now, it would be fantastic if you:  Have a strong understanding of software QA methodologies, testing tools, and processes. Have proficiency in automated testing tools and frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Detox) Are comfortable understanding and working with source code Have experience in a hyper -growth environment or large organization. Have effective communication and collaboration skills in English. What we offer A stock -option program for each Doctoliber A competitive health insurance paid 100% by the company A dedicated onboarding program  - the Doctolib Academy Mental health and wellbeing offer in partnership with moka.care The Doctolib Parent Care Program, including extended parental leave, meet -ups and inspiring conferences A subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative class Subsidy for lunch and various food offers in our offices A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office -based mode  Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year  The interview process  Recruiter Interview Feature Building Interview  System Design Interview Behavioral Interview Offer! If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest  Medium blog articles !  At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone  - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it! The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!  All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click  here . If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at  hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com .

description_entreprise: The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity. Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services. Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty. Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles. And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact. Therefore: We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature. We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees. We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve. We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration. We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model. We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage. We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

description: Our business, protection. We protect people, property and assets.  Our purpose, Act for Human Progress by protecting what matters. Does this speak to you? Then come and join 149,000 future colleagues who are committed to our 95 million clients in 50 countries around the world every day. Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. AXA is built around diversity and unity, which is why we are committed to promoting collective success through inclusion. Within the Group,  you will join the AXA Emerging Customers department . AXA‚Äôs Emerging Customer team leads AXA‚Äôs inclusive insurance strategy, which aims at protecting mass market and low-to-middle income segments across countries. The objective of our business is to protect vulnerable customers who are ill-insured and help them cope at time of financial distress. As an illustration, we develop small ticket insurance for small business owners, independent workers, farmers, migrant workers, etc.   This initiative is a defined business unit with commercial objectives as well as a social impact mission. More concretely, the Emerging Customers team supports AXA subsidiaries in countries to roll out their Emerging Customers‚Äô business through partnership-building, customer research, product development, design of customer journey, optimization of operations & IT, and impact assessment. The KPIs of our distribution partners and the priorities & needs of our end clients are central to the team: the objective is to anticipate changing social & economic needs to tailor our products and services accordingly. Clients-centricity is not just a buzz word: we apply human-centered design methodologies on the ground to tailor new products and services to customer needs leverage technology. We meet these needs by developing innovative solutions that leverage cutting-edge yet often simple technologies. Primary mission AXA Emerging Customers team is looking for a reporting analyst / developer with strong statistics skills and interest in the financial inclusion space willing to perform a 6 month internship. The primary mission will be to help the team improve the efficiency of performance tracking tools by designing, developing, testing, and supporting business intelligence and analytics solutions. The candidate will work closely with stakeholders to enhance and optimize user-friendly reports and dashboards, aligned with the desired requirements in data analytics projects and digital marketing campaigns across 14 countries.  Main activities Business reporting tools and data analytics projects Maintains, adapts, and enhances business dashboards and analytics tools under the guidance of the Data and analytics manager. Understands multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions. Ensures that all data is operationally accurate and appropriate throughout data management processes, including internal and external data collection, data transformation, data quality. Applies data visualization methodologies - often selecting the right data ‚Äòtool for the job‚Äô - to identify and improve business procedures and practices. Develops and delivers management dashboards and canned reports to support management oversight of business performance. Support actuaries and data analysts in ongoing projects.   Performance analysis and in-depth descriptive analytics on emerging customers projects: Performs in-depth descriptive analysis throughout the customer lifecycle of live programs, to provide data-driven insights that help improve business value and new business development. Uses data modelling techniques to identify ways in which a program can operate more effectively. Evaluates end-to-end digital customer experience to optimize and improve the reach and engagement of multiple digital marketing campaigns. Provides feedback on technology enhancements that could improve analytic tracking.

description: We are looking for an experienced  Game/Product Analyst  -he/she/they- to join our Growth Team. You will be responsible for  monitoring ,  analyzing , and  optimizing key performance indicators  across our products to help  maximizing long term revenue  and analyze and  improve the effectiveness of the player life cycle . You will do that by setting-up AB-tests of in-game features and create dashboards. You will regularly communicate your findings to Product, Management and Marketing teams to ensure your insights are used to inform decision making, to  drive the growth of multiple games  (focusing with the portfolio of Loop Games at first). You will work inside the Data Team (3 Data Analysts, 2 Data Engineers, 1 Analytics Engineer) and you will report to the VP of Growth. This position is  hybrid  (2 days per week at the office) and  located in Paris . Team description The Data team at 52 entertainment is full of talents working on Business & Financial, Product and Marketing KPIs. It is a cross-functional team that connects with all business units (US, Europe, Asia). The Data team is operating remotely:  we talk to each other on a daily basis and organize frequent virtual coffees ‚òïÔ∏è. Some are geeks, some are not, apply as you are,  we‚Äôre a diversity-friendly team  üßï üëßüèΩ ü•∑ üë®üèø üë© ü¶æ. In our team everyone is to be treated equally regardless of sex, race, gender identification, disability, age, religion, ‚Ä¶ Missions Support insight-driven decision making for several games Collaborate with Product, Marketing, Customer Success, Live Ops on - A/B testing initiatives - Personalization strategies - Launching new games on the market Develop and define KPIs and models to assess game performance Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players Design tests that investigate hypothesis and uncover customer insights Create, own and manage an evolving AB test roadmap Create and share actionable presentations and recommendations based on your findings to optimize the product roadmap and soft launch new games We‚Äôre excited about you because‚Ä¶ You‚Äôve learned to work as a  Product analytics for the past 3+ years . You like to discover new problems and investigate creative solutions. Been  working in the gaming industry for at least a couple of years , and know a few tricks to get players more engaged in game. While most of your time will be spent working with other cross-functional leaders, you make sure to  keep up to date with the latest trends in gaming and analytics . Can easily  communicate technical concepts to a wide variety of audiences  - from engineers/scientists to business stakeholders - and navigate between big-picture and technical details. Impressive  ability to prioritize and weigh impact vs. effort  and interest in how Analytics can help unlock faster growth and/or opportunities to increase margin and/or cut costs. Benefits Work in a start-up with exceptional growth Highly interesting work environment with flat hierarchies, fast pace, and fun If you have the potential, we will do everything to help you to achieve the highest level of personal and professional development. High autonomy. No micro-managing here. When you‚Äôll be up to speed, you‚Äôll be given high-level directions, and you will often be free to solve problems in the way you feel is best. Amazingly friendly Data team.

description: Are you a motivated and ambitious student enrolled in a business school program, eager to gain real-world experience in the dynamic field of Ecommerce performance analysis? Work with the IT team, performance office & intelligence team to enhance data visualization and reporting capabilities. Coordination with franchisees and Ecommerce Teams: Collaborate closely with the franchisee team and various countries to implement performance improvement actions. Liaise with the Ecommerce team to align strategies and initiatives for optimal results. Business Cases and Training Materials: Develop business cases to support proposed initiatives and strategies. Create training materials, webinars, and presentations to facilitate knowledge sharing within the organization. What We Offer: A challenging and rewarding internship experience. Exposure to a global company with opportunities for growth and development. Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals. A supportive and collaborative work environment. Competitive compensation.

description: As a  Data Business Intelligence Developer with a minimum of 2 years experience , you will assume a pivotal role within the ORIS organization, utilizing  data, business intelligence best practices and tools  to generate valuable insights and facilitate  well-informed decision-making . Prepare business oriented datasets for ad-hoc analysis. Publish reports to internal and external customers, embed the reports in our SaaS platform, and manage user permissions Project Management and stakeholder collaboration Collaborate with various stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders based on data analysis. Strategic Guidance and continuous improvement Stay updated on the latest business intelligence methodologies, tools and technologies. Promote the use of indicators and a data-driven culture.

description_entreprise: Better Trips for travelers. Better Trips for the world. Since Evaneos was founded in 2009, we‚Äôve been building a greener, fairer future for travel. By connecting travelers with the world‚Äôs best local experts, we provide trips that are better for them and better for the places they visit. For us, it‚Äôs all about quality and impact. That means fighting mass tourism and impersonal experiences at the expense of local communities and the environment. Instead, we offer tailor-made trips, lovingly crafted by those passionate about sharing and protecting the destinations they call home. Thanks to our network of more than 1000 local partners in more than 160 destinations, we‚Äôve helped more than 500,000 travelers plan extraordinary trips around the world. The adventure doesn‚Äôt stop here. We invest a percentage of every trip we sell in our Better Trips Fund and have committed to spend at least 3 million ‚Ç¨ by 2025 on projects that reduce the negative impacts of travel and drive positive change within our industry. Think: certified carbon offsets, planting mangrove trees, collecting ocean bound plastics, guiding small businesses through sustainability training and certification, creating new opportunities for woman-owned businesses, and much more. Our values are just as important within Evaneos. Our strength is in our diversity: our multitude of languages, backgrounds, and experiences. We believe in building the best teams by creating an environment where everyone can be authentic, trust each other and thrive. We hope you‚Äôll join us on our mission. You can also follow our  Glassdoor page  and see the comments of our current employees and candidates.

description_entreprise: Filiale de BNP Paribas, Manaos est une marketplace ¬´ SaaS ¬ª d‚Äôapplications d√©di√©s aux investisseurs institutionnels au service de la finance responsable et durable. Manaos d√©poussi√®re le monde de l‚Äôinvestissement pour lui permettre de relever les d√©fis √©cologiques et sociaux de notre temps, en utilisant une technologie cloud s√©curis√©e pour connecter les portefeuilles des investisseurs √† leur √©cosyst√®me : gestionnaires d‚Äôactifs, fournisseurs de donn√©es ESG ou fintechs. La valeur de notre plateforme s‚Äôappuie sur deux id√©es fortes : Aider l‚Äôinvestisseur √† mesurer de fa√ßon fiable son impact sur la plan√®te et la soci√©t√© : il doit donc ¬´ transpariser ¬ª ses portefeuilles de fonds pour pouvoir cr√©er des reportings. Sans notre outil, la composition des portefeuilles est opaque et l‚Äôinvestisseur ne sait pas o√π sont distribu√©s ses investissements. C‚Äôest le premier volet de notre solution. Pour mesurer l‚Äôimpact de ses investissements, un investisseur connecte ensuite ses donn√©es d‚Äôinvestissement √† une myriade d‚Äôagences de notation traditionnelles ou fintech. Il doit donc parvenir √† se connecter simplement et efficacement √† l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me. Sans notre outil, la connexion avec ces acteurs est extr√™mement complexe, p√©nible et co√ªteuse. C‚Äôest le second volet de notre solution. Avec cette marketplace, nous aspirons √† nous positionner comme un acteur majeur de la transition des institutions financi√®res vers la finance durable et de les accompagner dans leur processus d‚Äôinvestissement responsable √† l‚Äô√©chelle.‚Äã

description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. Job Purpose Review, monitor and control of risks related to Mortality and CAT underwritten by AXA‚Äôs entities. Provide 2nd Opinion on Protection PAP and GUC. Provide adequate risk monitoring framework (Risk Appetite). Validate the modeling and the calculation of Solvency Required Capital for Mortality and CAT risks, participate to review of entities (In-Depth Review) with respect to those risks, and review the 2nd Opinion on Reserves (Flash Process). Context & Major Challenges As a risk manager, the Mortality and CAT analyst is both an active controller of local teams‚Äô activities and a business partner. The position requires both strong modeling capacities to correctly measure the risk (profitability, reserves, required capital) but also good business knowledge to provide valuable business 2nd Opinion on underwriting processes (PAP, GUC). Key accountabilities Internal Model (STEC): Maintain and Improve the Internal Model for mortality and CAT risks including the Group Modeling for Pandemic risk. Contribute to auditors (internal and external) and regulators‚Äô exchanges on mortality and CAT risks. Validate yearly Solvency 2 Internal Model figures computations for mortality and CAT risks (2 risks x 12 entities), including local calibrations, STEC clearance meetings, analyzing and validating the results and contributing to the Group validation report and Group ORSA process. Define, produce and analyze the Per Event and Per Life Risk Appetite Framework and ensure that both the Management and the Board have a clear and consistent view of the risk and its status versus the risk limit. Product approval Process and Group Underwriting Committee for health products Participate to the protection PAP and GUC processes and ensure their consistency with the Group risk management strategy (Customer focus, decrease the share of financial STEC, increase the share of profitability coming from technical or expense margins‚Ä¶). Consider the impact of new regulations on the protection PAP and GUC. Support the entities to implement the Group risk management requirements. Ensure the protection PAP and GUC processes are well respected. Give a second opinion on the protection products failing to meet group requirements. Risk monitoring Review the local 2nd Opinion on Mortality reserving through the Flash Process and In-Depth reviews. Provide a 2nd Opinion on Protection Reinsurance deals. Participate to the 2nd Opinion on Protection Strat Plan.   Climate Change Contribute to Climate stress tests. Develop AXA‚Äôs view on Climate Change Scenarios.

description_entreprise: First of all: why ‚ÄúCybel‚Äù? Cybele was the keeper of knowledge in Greek mythology, and at CybelAngel we protect the knowledge of our customers. How? ‚ÄòOr‚Äô What ? By detecting data leaks on the vastness of the Internet (Deep web, Dark web, Clear web and Connected Objects). CybelAngel was founded in 2013 in Paris and we count more than 180 employees worldwide (in the US, France and the UK). We have a culture of team spirit, ambition and a high commitment to ethics. We are constantly looking to add new talents and expertise in order to help us solve the growing security threats over the Web. In order to ensure our growth, we carried out a successful Series B fund raise in Feb. 2020 with a total founding of $ 52M.  Our values: Be Curious; Be Bold and Stronger Together! CybelAngel‚Äôs mission is to create cutting-edge technologies to make the Internet a safer place. Thanks to our in-house developed solution we are able to detect data leaks over the Internet (e.g. Dark Web, Deep Web) as well as connected devices. Using artificial intelligence, we identify sensitive data and provide a real-time alert service to our clients. We are therefore able to help major companies in securing and protecting their sensitive and confidential information and anticipating high risk security threats.

intitule: Sr. Analyst - Speed differentiation, Delivery Speed and Long-term Planning
description: Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon websites and wondered how it got delivered to you so fast, and what kinds of systems & processes are running behind the scenes to power the whole operation? If so, this role is for you.  The team: Global transportation services, Speed and Long-term Planning  - Operations is at the heart of the Amazon customer experience. Each action we undertake is on behalf of our customers, as surpassing their expectations is our passion.  - We improve customer experience through continuously optimizing the complex movements of goods from vendors to customers throughout Europe.   - Global transportation analytical teams are transversal centers of expertise, composed of engineers, analysts, scientists, technical program managers and developers. We are focused on Amazon most complex problems, processes and decisions.  - We work with fulfillment centers, transportation, software developers, finance and retail teams across the world, to improve our logistic infrastructure and algorithms.   - Fulfillment acceleration is one of those Global transportation analytical team. We are obsessed by rethinking our advanced end-to-end supply chain to make our deliveries even faster. Our overall mission is simple: we want Amazon to be the place where our customers can be delivered the next-day.  Key job responsibilities You will be responsible for defining the overall delivery speed differentiation strategy across Europe. Navigating highly complex and strategic scope across end-to-end supply chain, including tradeoffs between cost to serve, customer delivery speed, selection, growth and long-term profitability. This is a role for an exceptionally talented person, with high energy and courage, passionate about delivering concrete improvement for our customers, and that want to achieve that using data.  The role includes 60% analytical activities and 40% of stakeholder/project management  Innovation & Stakeholder/Project management. - Use and share your insights with partner teams, to influence/build a 3 year roadmap of project to accelerate speed of deliveries  - For the most complex and ambitious opportunities, quickly launch new pilots, and build scale-up business case with benefits, tradeoffs, bottlenecks, risks and resources required   - For the algorithmic opportunities, work with teams of software developers and research scientists to design the next round of software innovation   - Lead regular business review with partner teams to monitor the progress of projects in the roadmap. Help into removing bottlenecks  - Consolidate progress into crisp and concise data-driven status updates. You will own reporting to Amazon senior leadership (VP-level) Data Analytics/Science  - Build advanced tools/models to automate decision making for complex and ambiguous trade-off problem  - Deep dive complex data using SQL (>10TB) to uncover actionable insights for known and unknown problems   - Use data to control/audit if our supply chain is behaving as expected, and automate the identification of improvement opportunities among dozens of dimensions We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Clichy, FRA

description: Our business, protection. We protect people, property and assets.  Our purpose, Act for Human Progress by protecting what matters. Does this speak to you? Then come and join 149,000 future colleagues who are committed to our 95 million clients in 50 countries around the world every day. Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. AXA is built around diversity and unity, which is why we are committed to promoting collective success through inclusion. Within the Group,  you will join  the Financial Risk and Transversal Processes department  in charge of Market and Credit risk calculation process, Pilar II regulatory reports and the coordination of internal risks indicator production and reporting. Within this Department, you will be part of  the team Financial Risks  and report to Financial Risk and Transversal Processes manager. Your job and daily missions The purpose is to participate in the Market and Credit SCR calculation process by ensuring the data quality analysis, the production of main risk indicators and participate in the analysis of change by Risk module and sub-module. Daily tasks: Support the financial instrument data upload in internal tool and perform the data quality controls. Participating in different study and analysis of the current asset and derivatives portfolios. Develop and enrich the internal tools for portfolio monitoring. Participate in the risk appetite indicators production. Collaborate with the FRM Group teams for the main financial risks indicators reporting. Participate in the Financial STEC analysis and ensure the rational of quarterly evolutions.

description_entreprise: Rejoindre la RATP, c‚Äôest int√©grer le 3√®me op√©rateur de transport public mondial, qui emploie plus de 70 000 collaborateurs dans 15 pays. C‚Äôest aussi rejoindre un groupe en pleine transformation, au sein duquel le digital et l‚Äôinnovation sont reconnus comme des leviers essentiels de performance et de croissance. A la RATP, la direction Digitale & Innovation (D&I) a pour ambition de soutenir le d√©veloppement du Groupe et de l‚Äôaccompagner face √† des d√©fis majeurs : ouverture √† la concurrence, sobri√©t√© √©nerg√©tique, pr√©paration des JO 2024 ou encore Grand Paris Express.  #Digital/SI Nos √©quipes digitales con√ßoivent, d√©ploient et exploitent des syst√®mes d‚Äôinformation et des solutions digitales de pointe au service des clients et des voyageurs (offre de transport, planification des trains/bus et personnels, s√ªret√© et maintenance des installations, exp√©rience voyageur, etc.).  #Digital Workplace Elles veillent aussi au bon fonctionnement de l‚Äô√©quipement informatique et des applications m√©tiers et apportent support et conseil aux collaborateurs.  #Data La RATP dispose d‚Äôun impressionnant patrimoine de donn√©es que nos experts data collectent et analysent pour renforcer la performance op√©rationnelle du Groupe et toujours mieux r√©pondre aux besoins des voyageurs et anticiper leurs usages.   #Cybers√©curit√©  La cybers√©curit√© est un enjeu majeur pour le Groupe. C‚Äôest la raison pour laquelle nos √©quipes cyber ‚Äì pr√®s d‚Äôune cinquantaine de personnes - se mobilisent pour s√©curiser nos syst√®mes, ma√Ætriser et g√©rer les risques, sensibiliser les collaborateurs aux bonnes pratiques.  #Transformation  Enfin, nous travaillons en √©troite collaboration avec les m√©tiers pour les accompagner efficacement dans leur transformation digitale.  #Innovation  Aux c√¥t√©s et en √©troite collaboration avec le digital, l‚Äôinnovation joue √©galement un r√¥le crucial pour le d√©veloppement et la comp√©titivit√© du Groupe et repr√©sente un marqueur fort de son ADN, depuis toujours.  La politique d‚Äôinnovation de la RATP se structure autour de 4 ambitions : innover au quotidien pour les voyageurs, inventer et construire les villes du futur, d√©carboner et √©conomiser l‚Äô√©nergie des transports, et enfin, acc√©l√©rer le leadership industriel du groupe. Pour servir ces ambitions, nos √©quipes innovation travaillent sur un grand nombre de projets (240 en 2022), portant sur :  Le d√©veloppement de la mobilit√© autonome et de l‚Äôintelligence artificielle : pour proposer des solutions de mobilit√© performantes et enrichir et faciliter le quotidien des voyageurs. La ¬´ smarter city ¬ª : pour ≈ìuvrer en faveur d‚Äôune ville apais√©e, plus sobre √©nerg√©tiquement et plus inclusive. De mani√®re transverse et pour soutenir le d√©ploiement de l‚Äôinnovation dans toutes les activit√©s du Groupe, nous capitalisons sur notre capacit√© d‚Äôinnovation interne (innovation participative) et sommes engag√©s dans une d√©marche d‚Äôopen innovation, toujours √† la recherche de partenaires (laboratoires de recherche, start-ups, industriels‚Ä¶) pour r√©fl√©chir et travailler aux mobilit√©s de demain et √† la ville du futur.

description: Our business: protection. We protect people, property and assets. Our purpose: Act for Human Progress by protecting what matters.Does this speak to you? Then come and join 149,000 future colleagues who are committed to our 95 million clients in 50 countries around the world every day. Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, in order to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, in order to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. AXA is built around diversity and unity, which is why we are committed to promoting collective success through inclusion. Within the Group, you will join the PBRC (Plan Budget Reporting Central) department. The main mission of PBRC department is to produce Group financial statements (IFRS and Solvency II) as part of which PBRC is also accountable for monitoring Group closing processes and the related central tools.  Within this Department, you will be part of the MASTER team (Management of Accounting Solutions, Tools, Expertise in Reporting)   group all the people involved in different tools on one single team with the following objectives: To increase agility during closing process and secure business continuity, thanks to a single team within PBRC managing all the activities. To better manage changes in regulation thanks to teams with cross tools competencies. To facilitate the relation with IT to reduce IT costs, optimize processes and be involved in the decisions with editors. The MASTER team is split into 4 main streams with a dedicated manager for each stream: Stream ‚ÄúActuarial tool support‚Äù  Stream ‚ÄúGeneral and Third-party accounting support‚Äù Stream ‚ÄúConsolidation & reporting tools support‚Äù Stream ‚ÄúConsolidation and transversal project support‚Äù The Senior analyst Finance Masterdata & authorizations role is part of the General and Third -party accounting support.This team is in charge of the functional expertise on GAP and manage central accounting processes across General ledger solutions. This stream interacts a lot with entities and IT teams managing this tool. Your job and daily missions: The mission of the Senior analyst Finance Masterdata & authorizations: For Masterdata domain, in close relationship with finance stakeholders, manage the AXA Group data model across several tools for :     Perform the creations / updates of various referential according to Group, GAP and IAP principles to ensure the efficient execution of financial processes (General Accounting Product (GAP) is the central GL accounting tool based on SAP technology used by all large insurance companies of the Group AXA, and Investment Accounting Product (IAP) the central accounting tool also based on SAP technology for financial assets of insurance companies of the Group AXA)   Ensure the consistency between all systems sharing the same data model and perform necessary alignments: This requires interaction with IT departments or business teams to achieve it. Contribute to projects by proposing re-use of existing MasterData or propose creation of new ones consistent with the existing models Propose improvements of MasterData tools in close cooperation with IT tools. Propose process improvements in the maintenance of all master data. These proposals should imply the different stakeholders of the process (local entities, IT teams, Business teams)  Provide support, guidance and training to the offshore CMDA (Central Master Data and authorizations) team based in India (this team is in charge to centralize part of master data requests done by the entities and to process them till the availability in the productive systems)  For Authorization domain:     Be owner of Core business roles and central business User Groups Be the point of contact for local authorization POCs to support local User Groups changes. Support CMDA on authorizations requests when required Ensure that security rules and segregation of duties are applied in all business authorizations. Ensure with AXA Go that IFC controls on recertification of users and SOD checks are timely and successfully executed. Be involved with AXA GO in tool updates (GRC (Governance Risk Compliance), ‚Ä¶). The holder of the position will have the opportunity to work closely with various stakeholders from several professional families but also the IT providers, and AXA entities spread over the world. The core activities of the Senior analyst Finance Masterdata & authorizations includes: Maintenance of Masterdata referential Conduct business analysis with IT and business functions Ensure data collection process is in place and up to date and comply with business requirements  Define data checks according to business rules and automatize them into the MDM tool Maintain alignments of various systems and coordinate the resolution of data quality issues with the different data owners and stakeholders Analysis of new requirements and propose reuse or creations but ensure global consistancy Participation in the design/testing/review of Master Data tools Ensure training for data producers, data owners, data consumers and make regular meetings with CMDA team to ensure timely and adequate execution of requests Participate to projects to propose enhancements but keeping global consistency with existing values and usages. Maintain authorization framework and validate global changes  Participation in the data governance framework related to Master Data and authorization Participation in IFC and external audits Documentation of all the decisions made on the stream Contribution to the change management Support Finance central teams and entities on any new initiatives related to Masterdata management and when new projects required Masterdata creation/updates Identify and manage critical data management issues and risks Participate to transversal global governance with entities, IT teams and other business support teams and when needed present some topics around Masterdata management and processes

C‚Äôest autour de la diversit√© et de l‚Äôunit√© que se construit AXA, c‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† promouvoir le succ√®s collectif par l‚Äôinclusion. Global Enterprise Management (GEM) is a new 3 years-old unit, reporting directly to the CEO office of the AXA Group. Fully focused on AXA most valued Global Business Partners, its mission is to build, expand and deliver revenue growth, high retention, and client advocacy in the Business-to-Business (B2B) space. This includes the development of B2B2Business, B2B2Customer, B2B2Employee across all AXA assets and capabilities. The operating model relies on a single point of contact per account leveraging central, regional, and local teams in a unified way and collaborating with all entities to diversify and deepen our GEMs portfolio for One AXA. Within GEM, the  Business & Transformation apprentice  will support the  Business Operations & Strategy Transformation Manager  on 3 major dimensions: Support the 2023 Global Brokers initiative with the newly appoint Global Head of Brokers: Build 360¬∞ view of AXA‚Äôs business relationship with its Top Global Insurance Brokers (starting in 2023 with 2 main Brokers as a pilot); Monitor our commercial performance as ONE AXA, considering Brokers as key partners; Share key insights on GEM‚Äôs global brokers (business insights, commercial strategy, internal news) to AXA Executive and GEM‚Äôs Commercial leaders. Survey competitors with available tools (Media reports, LinkedIn, press aggregators...) to feed the GEM community with valuable insights; Monthly and also ad-hoc analysis of Missed-Declined-Lost business opportunities, being able to investigate root causes of these data to provide learnings and potential improvement area for the commercial performance of GEM sales team. Key accountabilities: Collecting, updating, and analysing of AXA and GEM partners GWP with Global Brokers across the Group (for all AXA operating companies and for all lines of business). Building reporting and dashboards (Excel, PPTX) for our Management Committee and other high level executives. Building, analysing and sharing key business insights. Contributing to sectorial analysis of GEM‚Äôs business with our Global Brokers, both on data and qualitative insights (such as organization, strategy & offers). Assisting with project management for selected projects and contributing on other transversal missions when necessary. The apprentice will work closely with the Business Operations & Strategy team and will collaborate with many stakeholders within AXA Group: In the Global Enterprise Management team: Deal steering Leader Commercial Account leaders Regional Leaders In local entities: Account managers Business analysts In Group / Markets departments: Risk Management Operations: Technology, Data, Transformation and Innovation Finance

description_entreprise: The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures. description: I nternship Overview As a Customer Success Business Analyst Intern, you will be an integral part of our Customer Success team, where you‚Äôll gain hands-on experience in data analysis, business analytics, and customer relationship management within a SaaS environment. You will work closely with our team to drive data-driven decision-making and improve customer health scores. Main Activities During your internship, you will be involved in the following key activities: Data-Driven Health Scoring:  Conduct research to develop and enhance data-driven health scoring for SaaS companies, enabling us to better understand and improve customer health. Data-Driven Decision Making:  Assist in building processes that leverage data to make informed decisions about our subscribed customers‚Äô health and success. Grafana Dashboards:  Create and maintain dashboards using Grafana, which will help us answer questions about customer usage, value, and quality. Identify areas for improvement and potential obstacles. Customer Data and Knowledge Management:  Play a vital role in managing customer data and knowledge, ensuring we have a comprehensive understanding of our customer base. Customer Health Score Playbook:  Collaborate on building a playbook focused on customer health scoring, which will guide our approach to assessing and enhancing customer success. What You Will Work On   Your daily activities will be divided into approximately 70% data analytics and 30% operational improvements. Here are some specific tasks you‚Äôll be involved in: Data Analysis:  Compile and analyze data to help optimize our clients‚Äô outcomes and identify areas for improvement. Customer Trend Analysis:  Conduct in-depth reviews of customer trends to uncover opportunities for enhancing the customer experience and operational processes. Data Evaluation:  Research and evaluate data from various sources to identify patterns, trends, and discrepancies. Data Storytelling:  Convert data into meaningful insights that can be easily understood by clients, and effectively communicate the story behind the data. Communication:  Present your findings and analytic insights to management, contributing to data-informed decision-making. Client Performance Enhancement:  Suggest actionable strategies to enhance client performance based on your data analysis.

description: L'analyse Topologique des Donn√©es est un domaine de recherche r√©cent permettant de faire de nouvelles analyses et extraire de nouvelles connaissances dans des donn√©es complexes en haute dimension, en compl√©ment des m√©thodes actuelles. En particulier des caract√©ristiques g√©om√©triques des donn√©es peuvent √™tre prise en consid√©ration avec ces m√©thodes, ce qui est difficile, voire impossible, avec les m√©thodes plus traditionnelles.  L'objectif de ce stage est d'explorer des nouvelles opportunit√©s de mise en application de ces m√©thodes, en particulier dans le cas de la mesure des marges d'incertitudes des mod√®les. Actuellement, en effet, les performances des mod√®les sont mesur√©es √† un niveau global et il est difficile de pouvoir donner une marge d'incertitude au niveau d'une pr√©diction individuelle.  Dans ce stage, votre mission sera de faire une √©tude bibliographique sur l'√©tat de l'art, de d√©velopper et de mettre en ≈ìuvre des algorithmes innovant sur des cas concrets bancaires.

description: Your mission Helping the company be fully data-driven is not just a buzzword, it is our mission at Equativ. We, the Data Analytics team at Equativ, maximize efficiency by enabling easy and permanent access to quality data, valuable insights & rigorous thinking. Our responsibility is to ensure our local and central teams, clients and partners, make informed business decisions. To do so, we leverage huge volumes of data (Equativ handles 150Bn Auctions per Day) in a state-of-the-art tech stack (AirFlow, Snowflake, Tableau‚Ä¶) in order to provide actionable insights to all teams at Equativ! What you'll do  Reporting to the manager of the Analytics team, your mission will be to maintain and upgrade our data pipeline. Day-to-day maintenance of our data pipeline:  Ensure data pipeline ingestion accuracy in due time Follow-up on data quality issues raised by internal customers Improvement of sourcing processes: Migrate from Talend data flows to Python scripts for our sourcing jobs Develop resources to make Data Analysts autonomous in sourcing data in our Snowflake database (through ready-to-use scripts or small interfaces) Developing new projects on our main platforms (Tableau & Snowflake) Leverage new resources to make the most out of Snowflake (Streamlit, Snowpark‚Ä¶) Identify new ways to structure our data sources in Tableau while reducing the loading time for the user Participate in the restructuring of our data marts (schemas, stages & permissions) Communication: Sync with Data Analysts to make sure that their requests are properly prioritized Synchronize with other technical teams (Core-Data, Infra) to gather requirements of the migration and ensure a smooth transition Understand business needs to suggest the most efficient technical solution.  About you Pragmatic & hands-on mindset is required: you‚Äôll have latitude to explore different options, but you need to go for the most effective solution Technical knowledge of Python & SQL is a must. Knowledge of collaboration platforms (Gitlab) & Agile processes is a plus .You can demonstrate your ability to solve problems end to end. You are fluent in English. üëã  About us   Equativ is the new single name for Smart Adserver, DynAdmic, LiquidM and Nowtilus ‚Äî four proven innovators in advertising technology. The vertically integrated company provides brand and privacy-safe solutions that empower its clients to achieve maximum impact while respecting the rights of consumers. The union combines client expertise and engineering excellence to serve the interests of both the supply- side and demand-side with equal professionalism and technical sophistication. Headquartered in Paris and New York, Equativ operates globally with a team of more than 550 people in 20 offices. Equativ offers the market its own independent ad server, SSP, buyer tools, and media services to fulfill the promise of advertising technology. Learn more at  Equativ.com . The company is ranked on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 EMEA and in the Financial Times‚Äô FT 1000:  Europe‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Companies. Equativ (formerly Smart AdServer) has been awarded the  HappyIndex@Work label  and is proud to be among the best companies in the  ChooseMyCompany  ranking, recognized for its  flexible working environment. Come and lead the charge with us in  building a transparent ecosystem based on quality! ---------------------- Equativ is an equal opportunity employer. Equal access to employment, services, and programs are available to everyone, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you require reasonable accommodation throughout the application and/or interview process, please contact the recruitment team at ta-team@equativ.com

description: Company Name:  Pernod Ricard India Location:  Mumbai Start date:  March 2024 VIE criterias:  I graduated less than 1 year ago & EU Nationality. Company presentation: PR India is one of the 4 ‚Äòmust win‚Äô market for PR globally and is the largest business globally by volume and 3rd by value. We have a strong product portfolio across price points in whisky. PRI is growing aggressively at this point within the existing capacity and capabilities. Alcohol is a state subject in India ‚Äì implying that rules/regulations and pricing is different in 29 states. This impacts where we manufacture and the subsequent GTM significantly. To leverage on the tremendous opportunity that India as a market presents, we need to be more agile in deploying digital solutions. All of this will take laser sharp project management and a constant check to ensure that our strategy is relevant. We need to reach newer consumers and premiumize the buying decisions of the existing ones. To fuel the ambitious Transformation agenda, and as part of the Digital Transformation journey, we need to set best in class data governance and strategy capabilities to Harvest the potential of data on the full scope of activities of PRI to make it a business asset Create bridges between Business teams to ensure a smooth and sustainable transformation Protect the value and quality of this data asset through proper Governance, Methodology & Definitions (in close collaboration with the IT team) Own the Data Governance Capabilities to enable the capitalization and easy access of the knowledge and management of the data quality Job purpose: The role of the Data Ambassador is to maximize the use of PR India data assets, provide recommendations as required to facilitate data quality optimization and lead other data initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity to develop a wide variety of hard and soft skills, join a strategic global program whilst working with data experts and cross functional teams on advanced projects. Main Responsibilities: Provide data support for each Transformation initiative Maintain data map to show data flows and data ownership Ensure that data & KPIs are available and accessible to the right stakeholders Identify optimization to decrease level of manual work and improve efficiencies Enforce policies/procedures to promote data consistency and integrity across digital projects & programs (e.g. sell-out dashboard, master data management) Build/maintain consistent data quality monitoring, communicate on issues found and drive synchronizations to fix them Assess business cases for new data sources integration (2nd & 3rd party data), facilitating the discussion & decision across the business Launch initiatives to foster a data-driven culture across the organization

description_entreprise: 90% of the goods we buy are carried by sea in containers. description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing. Our purpose? Every day we boost our clients‚Äô data transformation into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations.  Our strength? Our data services stand on double expertise: the combination of Artificial Intelligence and the business prowess acquired from our customers around the world, such as AccorHotels, Orange, Carrefour, Engie, Samsung, L'Or√©al, Nissan...   Artefact‚Äôs success comes from a unique mix of company assets: cutting-edge data technologies, agile methodologies for fast delivery, cohesive teams assembling the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital marketing experts. Artefact  is : 13 offices in Paris, London, Shanghai, Dubai‚Ä¶ 900 employees 4 practices: Data Consulting, Data Marketing, Activation and Creation What you will be doing: Key responsibilities As a Data & Analytics Manager, your role will encompass: Deliver the highest standards of quality on Data marketing projects Pilot multidisciplinary teams (consultants, data scientists, data analysts, software engineers, media traders) Develop robust, industry-leading measurement and analytics projects that enable clients with visibility across physical and digital customer journeys (online and offline) Planning, leading and delivering advanced analytics strategy and solutions for clients including e-commerce, 3rd party tool implementations, and advanced modeling. Identify and support the delivery of suitable statistical data analysis techniques, to provide recommendations for clients which exceed performance expectations and maximizes ROI Explore automation techniques that create efficiencies and improve ROI (both internally and for clients) such as scripting, tool development or better client reporting methods Act as an internal consultant on analytics for significant projects, helping other teams to shape the very best solutions Lead through the ‚Äòpitch ownership‚Äô and by taking an ‚Äòanalytics lead‚Äô role on new business pitches Data Marketing and Analytics leadership Lead data analytics development, defining and communicating a clear strategy for the team and the value it will add to the agency Work together with the data consultants to champion analytics development and associated platforms on three fronts ‚Äì internally to the agency, externally to clients and to represent Artefact‚Äôs position to the wider marketing community Lead and develop roadmaps for our analytics offering, process, and techniques and develop best practice documentation Develop review and sign off processes to ensure analytics work is always of the highest possible quality Responsible for Artefact being known as exceptional in analytics in the wider market. Actively seek to build Artefact‚Äôs profile within the digital marketing community.     Qualifications: Education & experience required Having an academic level of education (Master), in a data marketing-driven working environment, you have : A minimum of 3 years of work experience in a data-driven working environment Deep understanding of data marketing and digital marketing ecosystem and issue, which included but not limited to data collection, campaign management, advanced segmentation, performance tracking, dashboarding, strategic attribution, marketing mix modelling, etc. Experience or have knowledge in digital marketing toolsets (DMP, DSP) and ecosystem building, Ideally, you have the knowledge or take interested in one or more of the following technologies: Advertising tools, linked to tracking and/or analytics in a marketing context (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DMP, DSP, Adservers, DV 360...)   1 or 2 programming languages among SQL, Python and/or R. 1 Data visualisation tool (Tableau, Data Studio, Dataviz, R / Python dataviz libraries, ...)  As a bonus, you have:  Knowledge in Cloud technologies (Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS, etc.). description: We're making the world of digital assets accessible and secure for everyone.  Join the mission.  Founded in 2014, Ledger is the global platform for digital assets and Web3. Over 15% of the world‚Äôs crypto assets are secured through our Ledger Nanos. Headquartered in Paris and Vierzon, with offices in the UK, US, Switzerland and Singapore, Ledger has a team of more than 700 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets ‚Äì including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 5 millions units already sold in 180 countries.  At Ledger, we embody the values that make us unique: Pragmatism, Audacity, Commitment, Trust and Transparency. Have a look at our Origins video  here .  We are seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to join our Delivery Management team as a Data and Business Intelligence Trainee. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects involving data analysis, business intelligence, over BI tools (such as Tableau) and integration with development platforms such as Jira and Github. This is a trainee position, offering hands-on experience in the field of data and business intelligence. The successful candidate will receive mentorship and training to enhance their skills and contribute to real-projects. Duration: 6 months Start date: January/ February/ March 2024 The mission Data Integration : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to connect and integrate data from various sources, including Jira and Github. Business Intelligence Development:  Design and develop Business Intelligence (BI) solutions to enable efficient data analysis and reporting. KPI and Reports Generation:  Define, track, and generate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and performance of projects.  Data Analysis:  Conduct in-depth data analysis to extract valuable insights, trends, and patterns.  Documentation:  Document data sources, processes, and BI solutions to ensure clarity and transparency. description_entreprise: Founded in 2014, Ledger is the global leader of security solutions and infrastructure for cryptocurrencies and blockchain applications, with more than 4 million users in 180 countries.  Ledger combines hardware and software expertise to secure billions of dollars worth of almost 2,000 different crypto assets - worldwide, 15% of these assets are managed through the Ledger ecosystem. Bolstered by accelerated growth (with revenue growing by 6 times between the first semesters of 2020 and 2021), and a new fundraiser that made Ledger a ‚Äúunicorn‚Äù worth 1.5 billion dollars, Ledger will be a major player in the fourth industrial revolution - the revolution of the Internet of Value, Web3, DeFi, and NFTs.  Ledger designs the most reliable and user-friendly solutions: their R&D team created an operating system, integrated into the Nano S and X, and a platform, Ledger Live, that allows users to take back control of their digital lives by acting as a secure gateway to the entire ecosystem of digital assets. Ledger has already welcomed more than 330 people in 2021 - and they‚Äôre just getting started. Based in Paris, Vierzon, Singapore, New York, London, Geneva, Montpellier and Grenoble, upon arriving at Ledger employees sign a ‚ÄúP.A.C.T‚Äù of values: Pragmatism, Audacity, Commitment, Transparency and Trust

description_entreprise: Stago is a French company in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry with international activities. With operations in 18 countries, it has nearly 2,600 employees, half of whom are based out of France. Stago is an independent, privately-owned company that brings together all skills and know-how in the field of biology and instrumentation to develop, manufacture and market the widest range of reagents and instruments for hemostasis analysis throughout the world. Using the most advanced computer, electronic and biological technologies, Stago invests in research and innovation to develop ever more effective reagents, instruments and diagnostic solutions. With more than 350 products on the market, Stago is a world leader in In Vitro Diagnostics and a preferred partner of medical laboratories. Customer satisfaction is a strong value and everyone is aware that behind their actions there is a patient.

description: About the job  At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we have one overarching mission - to work passionately, challenging ourselves and our industry every day, to drive what we believe is the next health revolution: evolving from simply serving consumers, to helping people help themselves - bringing ‚ÄúHealth in Your Hands‚Äù. We are building trusted & loved brands that connect with hundreds of millions of consumers worldwide, enabling better self-care for individuals and communities, while also contributing to a healthier planet. To fulfill this mission, we are embarking our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees in this journey because this is what will make us become the ‚ÄúBest Fast Moving Consumer Healthcare (FMCH) Company In & For the World‚Äù. Consumers at the heart of everything we do and we want to make a difference where it counts, driving leadership in the categories we play in: Allergy, Digestive Wellness, Pain, Physical & Mental Wellness, and Cough, Cold & Flu. To achieve this, we need strong talent who will help us shape the future of our Consumer Healthcare business and challenge our industry. We aspire to create a work environment where people can thrive, grow, and be at their best every day. We believe in operating with integrity and prioritizing the health and well-being of people and communities where we operate, working towards making a positive impact in the world. OUR CXA ANALYTICS TEAM The CXA Analytics is a global and fast-growing team with seasoned leaders in business intelligence and advanced analytics. Its purpose is to foster a culture of data-driven decisions and bring the outside-in with access to unique and rich-data on market sales including competitors and consumer choices. Our mission is to empower decision makers to make the right strategic choices and the optimal marketing resource allocation as well as execution. This is achieved by building powerful and timely consumption & market share visualizations, quantifying consumption drivers, uplift & ROI, by simulating investment scenarios, and lastly by forecasting future consumption & Sanofi sales. MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES: The Performance & Analytics Lead is responsible to bring the full analytics agenda to the global brand teams from business intelligence (sales/share performance & drivers, innovation & competitive intelligence) to advanced analytics (category forecast, A&P modelling, pricing elasticities, ‚Ä¶) as well as shaping brand strategies across a long-term horizon considering penetration/loyalty and equity measures. Further, it implies: Deliver and drive monthly performance reviews (MPRs) with and for global brands by Providing decisive diagnostic and forward-looking insights on holistic brand performance & drivers (media, price, distribution, innovation, competition) to influence decisions in monthly brand reviews and beyond (e.g. bi-annual budget allocation, yearly brand strategy). Visualizing and communicating data driven insights to the global brand team in a simple and intuitive way using PPT or PBI live dashboards. Outline, follow-up and through with business relevant actions in direct collaboration with Global Brand General Managers. Be the performance voice of global brand teams and establish a performance culture via Being fully proficient to access, analyze and interpret causal drivers data (e.g. distribution, media, finance). Deploy and train global brand teams on analytics capabilities. Acting as guardian and advocate of the global strategic Boost definitions and market classifications. Activating and improving standardized MPR capabilities. Contribute to unleashing performance analytics systems & data capabilities by  Mastering all aspects of analytic agenda e.g. business intelligence & data and advanced analytics in close collaboration with regional and zone Performance & Analytics community. Identifying and ingesting new existing data sources enabling faster & more granular performance understanding. Working with external vendors to industrialize capabilities involving both data ingestion and visuals creation. Contributing to achieving the vision of zero-slide-based performance reviews by igniting game-changing visualization and data-driven business cases to influence / drive decisions. Owning use cases of new BI technologies (such as GenAI) as well as scaling capability upon successful pilot phase. This role will report directly to the Performance Analytics Business Intelligence & Data Lead ABOUT YOU Education:  Bachelor/Master ‚Äòs degree in a quantitative discipline Experience : 5+ years‚Äô overall work experience in analytics experience (e.g. Business Intelligence, BOS, Finance, CMI, Growth Performance, Sales Excellence). Experience working with senior leadership a plus. Soft skills : Leadership, business ownership, influence & story-telling, collaboration & agile, technical & business fluency, data-driven culture, rigor, love & curiosity for numbers.  Technical skills : Deep proficiency required in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and PowerBI as well as in handling large data amounts. Knowledge around database management systems (e.g. Snowflake) is a plus. Further, the following expertise is desirable: (1) Expertise with regression techniques incl. forecasting such as ARIMA and typical libraries such Prophet and (2) Understanding of forecast-related data sources such as external trends (google trends, weather, flu, pollen, macro-socio/economic indicators, ‚Ä¶) and category to SKU historical sales/ (IQVIA, Nicholas Hall, Nielsen/IRI). Languages : English, French is a plus. Education : Bachelor/Master ‚Äòs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., data science, statistics, applied mathematics, marketing science, market research or economics) is preferred. The ideal candidate also holds a master‚Äôs degree in: Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, or a business/marketing major with strong analytics applications Pursue progress, discover extraordinary Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let‚Äôs be those people. At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com! At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all. As part of its diversity commitment, Sanofi is welcoming and integrating people with disabilities.
description_entreprise: At Sanofi, we pursue the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. In France, more than  20,000 passionate men and women  tirelessly push their limits to transform the practice of medicine and improve patient health with drugs and vaccines. The desire  to advance science is our strength . We want to improve the health of populations and find new solutions for patients by combining scientific progress and advanced technologies. In France, we provide more than 400 drugs, vaccines and health products, including 18 vaccines and more than 200 drugs of major therapeutic interest. Sanofi‚Äôs roots are anchored in France where most of the Research and Development is located. In the French medical research landscape, we hold a central role and actively participate in the construction of a dynamic health sector. To contribute to the world of tomorrow, three commitments guide our actions: access to care for the most vulnerable, inclusion of all through work and preservation of the planet. Nothing would be possible without the remarkable mobilization of our employees and partners.

description_entreprise: Stago is a French company in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry with international activities. description: What are you going to do? As a Junior Technical Support Specialist for SaaS clients, you will be the bridge between Technical Excellence and Client Satisfaction. Provide detailed and accurate information to assist in the resolution of escalated issues. Proactive Communication: Maintain proactive, reassuring, and transparent communication with clients throughout the support process. Keep clients informed on the status of their reported issues, ensuring a positive client experience. Technical Proficiency: Leverage your technical skills in Terraform, Golang, Docker, Kubernetes, Big Data, Distributed Databases, SQL, Python, and scripting languages. Apply expertise in analyzing and optimizing Tera or Peta scale data processes. End-to-End Support Involvement: Contribute to testing, deployment logics, hardware specifications, and integration processes to ensure robust and reliable SaaS solutions. Participate in on-call duties to address critical issues and maintain continuous service availability. Continuous Improvement: Actively seek opportunities for process improvement, providing valuable insights to enhance the overall support experience. Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to maintain a high level of technical competence. Join Opensee and be a key player in delivering unparalleled technical support for our innovative SaaS solutions. Your skills, commitment, and proactive approach will shape the success of our clients and the evolution of our cutting-edge products.

Today this fast-growing international Fintech offers a high performance solution to the major financial institutions in Paris, London and New-York, helping them overcome new risk management challenges by handling and exploiting their massive datasets.
